captions.text: 'Here's this guy reading the dealer's hole card
'and signaling his buddy at this table.'
(Tapping, beeping)
'That's just What these hustlers look for.

'They cruise the casinos
looking for Weak dealers
'the Way lions look for Weak antelope.'

Operator, this is Mr. R. Get me Armstrong
and Friday at pit tWo right aWay.
BJ 19, second base, the beard.
Operator, I need Mr. Happy. Loud.
# Happy birthday to you
# Happy birthday to you
(AII join in) # Happy birthday dear Jack
# Happy birthday to you #
(Cheering)

- (Electronic buzz)
- Oh!
(Man) Man doWn!

Go get medical.
We got a cardiac arrest here.

He's fine, folks.
Just give us some room, please.
Watch yourselves.

(Ace) 'They never knoW What hit them
and if and When they do find out

'that they got zapped by a cattle prod,
they Wish they really did have a heart attack.

'Turns out this guy and his pals
Were knockin' this place dead for years.

- He's got a Wire.
- What are you doing?

- There it is.
- That's it.

- Cheater's justice.
- Oh, God!
(Electronic Whirring)
Please, no, no. No!

'I Wanted everybody to knoW
that things Were changed around here.

'We had to make an example of these pricks
that the party Was over.'

I'm curious. I saW you shuffling
your checks With your right hand.

- Can you do that With both hands?
- No.

- You can't?
- No, sir.

- Can you do it With your left hand?
- I never tried.

- So, you're a righty?
- Yeah.
Ah! Oh! Ah. God, ah!
(Moaning)

NoW you're gonna have to learn
With your left hand.

comments.text:
I lived in Vegas in the 80s and something like this actually happened in 
the Horseshoe Casino (downtown, Fremont St), though not this bad. But the 
two guys who got roughed up went running to the police, they were able to 
sue the Horseshoe, and the whole thing was settled out of court.﻿

comments.author: brian behave

comments.text:
+manictiger Yep, there's uniformed cops working for the casinos that didn't 
give two shits what mob-run enforcers were doing.  It was either work 
within the system or the only work you'd have in that town is as a busboy 
or dishwasher. Make a lot of noise about it if you want to wind up in a 
hole in the desert.  

It's also true that the mobsters had the $400/hr lawyers downtown who were 
golf buddies with the judges and DAs.  Suing a casino in that court system 
was about as likely as getting to the moon in a Chevy Chevette.

comments.text:
Every movie is fictionalized. You want reality,watch a documentary.
As for the Glamorization, I think it fits. The film is being shown through 
Sam Rothstein's point of view...as a professional gambler and a mob 
associate, how else would he see Vegas if not through glamour?
